cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then bending west to west-southwest toward the southern North Carolina / northeastern South Carolina coast before drifting inland across South Carolina and eventually weakening while moving toward central Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Wilmington, NC (southern North Carolina coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Tropical Storm Warning south of South Santee River to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of North Carolina, South Carolina, and portions of southeast Virginia; minor peripheral effects possible along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.wind: Periods of gusty easterly winds possible, but tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤14% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible due to long-period swells; significant inundation not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain through the weekend, locally higher in squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents for vessels operating near the harbor entrance.
